fields.game_description: A web-based CTF game inspired by Itachi's Sharingan Izanami from Naruto Shippuden.

fields.title: Welcome to Izanami CTF!
fields.content: Welcome to Izanami: The Endless Loop! This CTF game is designed to test your web hacking skills through a series of challenges inspired by Itachi's Sharingan Izanami technique. Break free from the loop by solving challenges and earning Sharingan points. Good luck!

fields.title: New Challenges Released
fields.content: We've just released a new set of challenges in the Chunin level. These challenges focus on API vulnerabilities and WebSocket exploitation. Test your skills and earn more Sharingan points!

fields.name: Academy
fields.description: Beginner-level challenges designed to introduce you to basic web vulnerabilities.

fields.name: Chunin
fields.description: Intermediate challenges that require a deeper understanding of web security concepts.

fields.name: Jōnin
fields.description: Advanced challenges that often require chaining multiple vulnerabilities together.

fields.name: Uchiha
fields.description: Expert-level challenges that require mastery of multiple attack vectors and creative thinking.

fields.name: SQL Injection
fields.description: Challenges focused on exploiting SQL injection vulnerabilities to extract data or bypass authentication.

fields.name: XSS
fields.description: Cross-Site Scripting challenges that test your ability to inject and execute malicious JavaScript.

fields.name: CSRF
fields.description: Cross-Site Request Forgery challenges that involve tricking users into performing unwanted actions.

fields.name: Memory Manipulation
fields.description: Challenges that require manipulating memory values in games or applications to reveal flags.

name: File Upload
description: Challenges that involve exploiting file upload vulnerabilities to achieve code execution.

fields.name: SSRF
fields.description: Server-Side Request Forgery challenges that involve making the server request internal resources.

fields.name: Command Injection
fields.description: Challenges that involve injecting OS commands into vulnerable applications.

fields.name: Deserialization
fields.description: Challenges focused on exploiting insecure deserialization to achieve code execution.

fields.name: WebSocket
fields.description: Challenges that involve exploiting vulnerabilities in WebSocket connections.

fields.name: API
fields.description: Challenges focused on finding and exploiting vulnerabilities in web APIs.

fields.name: GraphQL
fields.description: Challenges that involve exploiting vulnerabilities in GraphQL implementations.

fields.name: Race Condition
fields.description: Challenges that involve exploiting timing vulnerabilities in web applications.

fields.name: Prototype Pollution
fields.description: Challenges focused on exploiting JavaScript prototype pollution vulnerabilities.

fields.title: Login Bypass
fields.description:
The Academy entrance exam requires you to log in as an administrator. Can you bypass the login form?

Hint: The query might be vulnerable to SQL injection.

fields.title: Greeting Card
fields.description:
The Academy has a greeting card system for new students. Can you find a way to execute JavaScript on this page?

Try using the 'name' parameter in the URL.

fields.title: Profile Update
fields.description:
The Academy allows students to update their profiles. Can you find a way to make an administrator update their profile without their knowledge?

Hint: The form might be missing something important.

fields.title: Scroll Repository
fields.description:
The Academy has a repository for storing training scrolls. Can you upload a malicious file to gain access to the server?

Hint: The file upload system doesn't properly validate file types.

fields.title: Weather Checker
fields.description:
The Chunin exam includes a weather checking service. Can you make it fetch data from internal services?

Hint: The service makes HTTP requests based on user input.

fields.title: Network Ping
fields.description:
The Chunin exam includes a network diagnostic tool. Can you execute arbitrary commands on the server?

Hint: The tool uses user input to construct a command line.

fields.title: Jutsu Storage
fields.description:
The Jōnin exam includes a system for storing jutsu techniques. Can you exploit the deserialization process to execute code?

Hint: The system uses pickle for serialization.

fields.title: Telepathic Communication
fields.description:
The Jōnin exam includes a telepathic communication system using WebSockets. Can you exploit vulnerabilities in the WebSocket connection?

Hint: The system doesn't properly validate messages or authenticate users.

fields.title: Ninja Registry
fields.description:
The Uchiha clan maintains a registry of all ninjas. Can you exploit the API to access unauthorized data?

Hint: The API has broken access controls.

fields.title: Sharingan Database
fields.description:
The Uchiha clan uses a GraphQL API to query their Sharingan database. Can you exploit vulnerabilities in the GraphQL implementation?

Hint: Try introspection and nested queries.

fields.title: Time-Space Ninjutsu
fields.description:
The Uchiha clan has developed a time-space ninjutsu system. Can you exploit race conditions in the implementation?

Hint: Try making multiple requests simultaneously.

fields.title: Bloodline Limit
fields.description:
The final Uchiha challenge involves exploiting prototype pollution in their JavaScript implementation. Can you modify the Object prototype to trigger unexpected behavior?

Hint: Try adding properties to Object.prototype through the user configuration system.

fields.content: Try using ' OR '1'='1 in the username field to bypass the login.
Try injecting <script>alert(document.cookie)</script> in the name parameter.
The form is missing CSRF protection. Create a form on another site that submits to this endpoint automatically.
Try uploading a file with a double extension like malicious.php.jpg or changing the Content-Type header.
Try accessing internal services using file:// or http://localhost URLs.
Try using command separators like ; or && to execute additional commands.
Create a malicious pickle payload that executes code when deserialized. Look into the __reduce__ method.
The WebSocket doesn't validate the sender. Try impersonating other users or injecting HTML/JavaScript in messages.
Try modifying the user ID parameter to access other users' data. The API doesn't check if you're authorized to view that data.
Use GraphQL introspection to discover hidden fields and queries. Try creating a deeply nested query to cause a DoS.
The system doesn't handle concurrent requests properly. Try making multiple requests to transfer points simultaneously.
Try adding a property to Object.prototype by passing a JSON payload with __proto__ in it.

fields.name: Academy Graduate
fields.description: Complete all Academy level challenges

fields.name: Chunin Exam Survivor
fields.description: Complete all Chunin level challenges

fields.name: Jōnin Elite
fields.description: Complete all Jōnin level challenges

fields.name: Uchiha Prodigy
fields.description: Complete all Uchiha level challenges

fields.name: SQL Master
fields.description: Complete all SQL Injection challenges

fields.name: Script Kiddie
fields.description: Complete all XSS challenges

fields.name: First Blood
fields.description: Be the first to solve any challenge

fields.name: Perfect Loop
fields.description: Solve a challenge without using any hints

fields.title: Memory Manipulation Mastery
fields.description: In this challenge, you'll need to manipulate memory values in a Pygame game to reveal the hidden flag. Look for patterns and secret values that can be modified to progress through the game. Use memory inspection tools or debug the game to find the flag parts.

fields.content: Try using keyboard shortcuts like Ctrl+M to reveal memory values and Ctrl+C to see collected values.
The flag is split into 4 parts. You need to collect specific values in a certain order to reveal each part.
The secret values are: 42, 13, 37, and 73. Try to collect these in different combinations.
